required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Non-Invasive Hemoglobin in Trauma Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Non-Invasive Hemoglobin in Trauma Patients Using FDA-Cleared Masimo Pulse CO-Oximeter

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, non-blinded, non-randomized, interventional study of the Masimo pulse oximeter and sensors in a trauma setting

detailed_description.textblock: The study aimed to evaluate SpHb's ability to detect critical drops in a trauma population

primary_outcome.measure: SpHb's Ability to Detect Critical Drops
primary_outcome.description: The ability of noninvasive continuous total hemoglobin (SpHb) to detect critical drops in arterial or venous hemoglobin values, calculated using chi-squared analysis.

arm_group.description: Each test subject will receive a Radical-7 Pulse CO-Oximeter and sensor that will remain on the subject for the first 24 hours following ED admission or discharge from the ICU/IMU.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Estimated 16 years of age or older or greater than or equal to 50 kg body weight if age unknown.
- Level 1 (highest trauma activation) status at the time of arrival to emergency department (ED).
- Expected to be admitted to the ICU/IMU for in hospital care.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Moribund patients with devastating injuries and expected to die within one hour of ED admission.
- Prisoners, as defined as those who have been directly admitted from a correctional facility (a free living individual who is under police observation as a suspect will remain in the study until hospital discharge).
- Obvious pregnancy in the ED.
- Received greater than 5 minutes of cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) in the pre-arrival or hospital setting.
- Has, on the ring, middle and index fingers of both hands, any of the following: finger deformities, injuries, including burns, scar tissue or infection, or any material that may interfere with sensor application or trans-illumination of the site.
- Has significant bilateral trauma to the arms or forearms.

facility.name: University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Test Subjects
group.description: Each test subject will receive a Radical-7 Pulse CO-Oximeter and sensor that will remain on the subject for the first 24 hours following ED admission or discharge from the ICU/IMU. Radical-7 Pulse CO-Oximeter and sensor: Noninvasive device that measures hemoglobin.

group.title: Test Subjects
group.description: Each test subject will receive a Radical-7 Pulse CO-Oximeter and sensor that will remain on the subject for the first 24 hours following ED admission or discharge from the ICU/IMU. Radical-7 Pulse CO-Oximeter and sensor: Noninvasive device that measures hemoglobin.

outcome.title: SpHb's Ability to Detect Critical Drops
outcome.description: The ability of noninvasive continuous total hemoglobin (SpHb) to detect critical drops in arterial or venous hemoglobin values, calculated using chi-squared analysis.
outcome.population: Sufficient number of cases to meet sample size criteria for assessing outcomes was not achieved. The protocol required a minimum of 50 subjects with at least 2 blood samples to conduct an interim analysis to calculate final sample size in order to obtain to a definition of critical drop detection. This study was not able to meet this target and therefore a critical drop could not be defined (primary outcome measure).

group.title: Test Subjects
group.description: Each test subject will receive a Radical-7 Pulse CO-Oximeter and sensor that will remain on the subject for the first 24 hours following ED admission or discharge from the ICU/IMU. Radical-7 Pulse CO-Oximeter and sensor: Noninvasive device that measures hemoglobin.

measure.title: SpHb's Ability to Detect Critical Drops
measure.description: The ability of noninvasive continuous total hemoglobin (SpHb) to detect critical drops in arterial or venous hemoglobin values, calculated using chi-squared analysis.
measure.population: Sufficient number of cases to meet sample size criteria for assessing outcomes was not achieved. The protocol required a minimum of 50 subjects with at least 2 blood samples to conduct an interim analysis to calculate final sample size in order to obtain to a definition of critical drop detection. This study was not able to meet this target and therefore a critical drop could not be defined (primary outcome measure).

reported_events.time_frame: Subjects were monitored during participation in the study in the ED and their stay in ICU.

group.title: Test Subjects
group.description: Each test subject will receive a Radical-7 Pulse CO-Oximeter and sensor that will remain on the subject for the first 24 hours following ED admission or discharge from the ICU/IMU. Radical-7 Pulse CO-Oximeter and sensor: Noninvasive device that measures hemoglobin.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
